input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Drinking coffee has a direct effect on wife and alarm clock. Wife has a direct effect on alarm clock. The overall probability of drinking coffee is 77%. The probability of not drinking coffee and ringing alarm is 7%. The probability of drinking coffee and ringing alarm is 35%. Is the chance of ringing alarm smaller when observing drinking coffee?
